abstract: Constants specifying how you want to launch an app

# NSWorkspace.LaunchOptions

**Structure**

Constants specifying how you want to launch an app

## Declaration

```swift
struct LaunchOptions
```

## Options

- **andPrint**: Print items instead of opening them.
- **withErrorPresentation**: Display an error panel to the user if a failure occurs.
- **inhibitingBackgroundOnly**: Causes launch to fail if the target is background-only.
- **withoutAddingToRecents**: Do not add the app or documents to the Recents menu.
- **withoutActivation**: Launch the app but do not bring it into the foreground.
- **async**: Launch the app and return the results asynchronously.
- **allowingClassicStartup**: Start up the Classic compatibility environment, if it is required by the app.
- **preferringClassic**: Force the app to launch in the Classic compatibility environment.
- **newInstance**: Create a new instance of the app, even if one is already running.
- **andHide**: Tell the app to hide itself as soon as it finishes launching.
- **andHideOthers**: Hide all apps except the newly launched one.
- **default**: Launch the app asynchronously and launch it in the Classic environment, if required.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Types

- **NSWorkspace.LaunchConfigurationKey**: The following keys can be used in the configuration dictionary of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWorkspace/launchApplication(at:options:configuration:)] method.  Each key is optional, and if omitted, default behavior is applied.
- **NSWorkspace.FileOperationName**: Constants that define types of file operations.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
